body_html:
When creating a Project file using the CMake program, one_hot_op.cc and one_hot_op.h files are not included in the tf_core_kernels.vcxproj file.

After the build is done manually, I can check the result properly by applying the simple C ++ code const-> one_hot-> clientsession class using the corresponding library and object file.

However, a little more complex sample code
Using FifoQueue, QueueEnQueue
Samples using FixedLengthRecordReader-> ReaderReadUpTo-> DecodeRaw-> OneHot will show abnormal termination in r1.5 version.
This sample performs normal operation in r1.3.

This sample works normally when the OneHot is disconnected, but it ends abnormally when connecting OneHot. (stack -> PollLoop, PoolEvent....)

CMake generation will require one_hot_op.cc and one_hot_op.h files to be included.
and OneHot ...

body:
When creating a Project file using the CMake program, one_hot_op.cc and one_hot_op.h files are not included in the tf_core_kernels.vcxproj file.

After the build is done manually, I can check the result properly by applying the simple C ++ code const-> one_hot-> clientsession class using the corresponding library and object file.

However, a little more complex sample code
Using FifoQueue, QueueEnQueue
Samples using FixedLengthRecordReader-> ReaderReadUpTo-> DecodeRaw-> OneHot will show abnormal termination in r1.5 version.
This sample performs normal operation in r1.3.

This sample works normally when the OneHot is disconnected, but it ends abnormally when connecting OneHot. (stack -> PollLoop, PoolEvent....)

CMake generation will require one_hot_op.cc and one_hot_op.h files to be included.
and OneHot ...
